intro: Galium orizabense subsp. laevicaule, commonly known as the smooth bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit and small, lanceolate leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and native plant gardens.
